pullRequest.title: [Preview] Fix multiplexingClient not allowing re-registered clients to subscribe to twin/methods
pullRequest.bodyText: If a client subscribes to twin and method, then unregisters from its multiplexing client, and is later re-registered, the default behavior will be to not preserve those subscriptions. We can add an optional parameter to enable this sort of behavior later, if users are interested.

afterCommit.message:
fix(iot-dev): Fix multiplexingClient not allowing re-registered clients to subscribe to twin/methods

Added some clarification in the javadocs for register/unregister to explain that subscriptions from a previous connection are not preserved when re-registered.

nodes.bodyText: Elsewhere in this class, this field is assigned when the user wants to subscribe to methods. When not null, this layer assumes that it is already subscribed. So setting this value to null again allows users to subscribe to methods again later if they re-register
MessageCallback allows for us and users to set the callback to null, but methods and twin do not, hence the need for these new markTwin/MethodAsUnsubscribed methods
